file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 52-42-01-04 - COCKPIT-UNDERFLOOR ACCESS HATCH - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL COCKPIT-UNDERFLOOR ACCESS HATCH - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to remove and install the cockpit underfloor access hatch. B. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY COCKPIT UNDERFLOOR ACCESS ALL 52-42-01-000-801-A HATCH - REMOVAL COCKPIT UNDERFLOOR ACCESS ALL 52-42-01-400-801-A HATCH - INSTALLATION EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 52-42-01 Page 1 of 5 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 52-42-01-000-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 2. COCKPIT UNDERFLOOR ACCESS HATCH - REMOVAL A. General (1) This task gives the procedures to remove the cockpit underfloor access hatch. B. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 123 123BL Area below the cockpit floor - LH C. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable D. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable E. Consumable Materials Not Applicable F. Expandable Parts Not Applicable G. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task On the cockpit underfloor access hatch H. Removal (Figure 401) SUBTASK 020-002-A (1) Move the hook (1) and unlatch the actuating handle (2) to open the door. (2) Push the door (3) to gain access to the lock pin (4). (3) Pull the lock pin to remove the door (3). (4) If necessary, remove and disassemble the handle (2) as follows: (a) Remove and discard the cotter pin (5). (b) Remove the nut (6), washer (7), and handle (2). (c) If necessary, disassemble the handle (2) as follows: 1 Remove and discard the cotter pin (12). 2 Remove the washer (13), pin (8), shaft (14), spacer (10), spring (11), and bushing (9) from the handle (2). AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: ALL Cockpit Underfloor Access Hatch - Removal/Installation Figure 401 - Sheet 2 14. SHAFT 8. PIN 13. WASHER 12. COTTER PIN 11. SPRING 9. BUSHING (2) 10. SPACER DET. E EM145AMM520687A.DGN EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 52-42-01 Page 4 of 5 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 52-42-01-400-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 3. COCKPIT UNDERFLOOR ACCESS HATCH - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This task gives the procedures to install the cockpit underfloor access hatch. B. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 123 123BL Area below the cockpit floor - LH C. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable D. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable E. Consumable Materials Not Applicable F. Expandable Parts Not Applicable G. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task On the cockpit underfloor access hatch H. Installation (Figure 401) SUBTASK 420-002-A (1) If the handle (2) is disassembled, assemble it as follows: (a) Install the bushings (9), spring (11), spacer (10), shaft (14), pin (8), washer (13), and a new cotter pin (12). (2) If the handle (2) is removed from the cockpit underfloor access hatch, install the handle (2) as follows: (a) Install the handle (2), washer (7), nut (6), and a new cotter pin (5). (3) Put the door (3) in its housing. (4) Pull the lock pin (4) to install the door. (5) Move the hook (1) and latch the actuating handle (2) to close the door.
